member.summary: Gets the current actual full count of the items in the data source.

member.summary: Gets the current actual primary key of the data source. This may have been auto detected, if possible, or provided or overriden by the user.

member.summary: Gets the resolved schema for the data source. Represents which properties are available for the items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.DeferAutoRefresh
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the auto refresh mechanism of the data source is currently defered. The data source will not react to most setting changes while this is set to true an will instead defer processing. Setting this value to false will queue a new refresh.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.ExecutionContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the execution context that the data source should synchronize asynchronous actions with, or use to defer delayed actions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.FilterExpressions
member.summary: Gets a collection to add filter expressions to. Changing the filter expressions in this collection will adjust the filter applied to the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.FirstVisibleIndexRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets which index consumers of the data source desire to be the current first visible index. A grid, for example, would indicate the current visible top row, and update this as that changes.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.IsFilteringSupported
member.summary: Gets if filtering is supported on the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.IsItemIndexLookupSupported
member.summary: Gets whether lookup of an index for a provided item is supported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.IsKeyIndexLookupSupported
member.summary: Gets whether lookup of an index for a provided primary key value is supported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.IsSortingSupported
member.summary: Gets if sorting is supported on the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.IsVirtual
member.summary: Gets if the current data source is a virtual data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.LastVisibleIndexRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets which index consumers of the data source desire to be the current last visible index. A grid, for example, would indicate the current visible top row, and update this as that changes.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.NotifyUsingSourceIndexes
member.summary: Gets whether, when manually notifying the data source of changes, one should use indexes relative to the actual source data, or relative to the view the data source is maintaining into the data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.PrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of property references that indicate the user provided primary key of the items in the data source. Consumers of the data source will often need to uniquely identify items in the data source. For this purpose a primary key should be specified.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.PropertiesRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of property references for the properties desired by the consumer of the data source. If known, the data source may take steps to request only those properties, or to ensure that those properties are included, rather than the default behavior for this type of data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.SortDescriptions
member.summary: Gets a collection to add sort descriptions to. Changing the sort descriptions in this collection will adjust the sort applied to the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.UpdateNotifier
member.summary: Gets or sets an IDataSourceUpdateNotifier that the data source should invoke methods on to indicate various changes have occurred.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.FlushAutoRefresh
member.summary: Called to make sure a queued refresh of the data source has been applied before continuing. Should only be needed if you are trying to synchronously examine the results of changing settings on the data source. Note, for a virtual data source, the data source itself may be waiting for other synchronous requests to actualize data. This call will not wait for those, but will only make sure the appropriate requests are in flight from the settings changes

member.param: The index of the requested item.
member.returns: The item at the requested index.

member.returns: The value of the specified property.

The property value from which to extract a value.
member.returns: The value of the specified property

member.name: M:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.IndexOfItem(System.Object)
member.summary: Called to return the index for an item contained in the data source, or -1, if the item can't be found, or this action isn't currently supported.
member.param: The item for which to find the index.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.IndexOfKey(System.Object[])
member.summary: Called to return the index for an primary key value contained in the data source, or -1, if the key can't be found, or this action isn't currently supported.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.IsPlaceholderItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the item at the requested index is a placeholder item and has not been actualized.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.NotifyClearItems
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that the data it has bound to has been cleared and needs to be re-examined. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.NotifyInsertItem(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been inserted in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the inserted item.
The new item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.NotifyRemoveItem(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been removed in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the removed item.
The old item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.NotifySetItem(System.Int32,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been changed in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the changed item.
The old item at the desginated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.
The new item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.summary: Called to manually queue a refresh of the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.DeferAutoRefresh
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the auto refresh mechanism of the data source is currently defered. The data source will not react to most setting changes while this is set to true an will instead defer processing. Setting this value to false will queue a new refresh.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.FlushAutoRefresh
member.summary: Called to make sure a queued refresh of the data source has been applied before continuing. Should only be needed if you are trying to synchronously examine the results of changing settings on the data source. Note, for a virtual data source, the data source itself may be waiting for other synchronous requests to actualize data. This call will not wait for those, but will only make sure the appropriate requests are in flight from the settings changes

member.name: M:Infragistics.Core.Controls.DataSource.IDataSource.Refresh
member.summary: Called to synchronously refresh the data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Core.PolySimplification.VertexReduction(System.Tuple{System.Double[],System.Double[]},System.Double)
member.summary:
Simple vertex reduction algorithm. Complexity: O(n)
Summary: Include P0 in the result, and set R = P0. Iterate through subsequent points P1,P2,... until distance(PN, R) > tolerance. Include PN in the result, and set R = PN. Continue iterating in this fashion until there are no more points to consider for inclusion.
member.param: Input list of points
The minimum distance allowed between adjacent points

member.summary: Returns the square of the distance between p1 and p2.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LinearFit(System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double},System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Creates coefficients for the linear least squares fit y=A+Bx
member.param: Number of items in the series.
Delegate which returns the nth x value.
Delegate which returns the nth y value.
member.remarks:
If either of the x or y for a given point are NaN, the point is not taken into account for the fitting operation. Infinite values are valid, but are likely to result in numerical instability.
Weisstein, Eric W. "Least Squares Fitting." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LeastSquaresFitting.html
member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

function evaluation point
member.returns: Evaluated function, or NaN if the function cannot be evaluated

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LogarithmicFit(System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double},System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Creates coefficients for the logarithmic least squares fit y=A+Blnx
member.param: Number of items in the series.
Delegate which returns the nth x value.
Delegate which returns the nth y value.
member.remarks:
If either of the x or y for a given point are NaN or the x is not positive, the point is not taken into account for the fitting operation. Infinite values are valid, but are likely to result in numerical instability.
Weisstein, Eric W. "Least Squares Fitting--Logarithmic." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LeastSquaresFittingLogarithmic.html
member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

function evaluation point

member.name: T:Infragistics.Portable.ISmartPlaceable
member.summary: Interface for objects placed by a smart placer object.
member.remarks: Although there is a clear intent to SmartPosition values, implementing classes are free to interpret the values as they wish. The only restriction being that the position parameter be interpreted coherently: the bounds set by calling SetPosition() should be identical to those returned by calling GetPosition()

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.ISmartPlaceable.GetSmartPositions
member.summary:
Gets an array of valid positions for the current object. Objects can individually place restrictions on where they can be placed, although in reality it's more likely that they'll just return a static array.
The order of the valid positions has some significance, in that although the placer will choose the best overall position, it will stop searching as soon as it finds an ideal one. The upshot of all of this is that you should return an array sorted in order of preferred placement.
member.returns: Array of valid smart positions for the current object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.ISmartPlaceable.GetSmartBounds(Infragistics.Portable.SmartPosition)
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the current object if it were placed at the specified position.
member.param: Smart position for bounds.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.ISmartPlaceable.SmartPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the current object.
member.remarks: After the smart position is set, the current object's bounds are assumed to be that returned from GetSmartBounds() if called with the same position.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.ISmartPlaceable.Opacity
member.summary: Sets or gets the opacity of the current object.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Portable.SmartPlacer
member.summary: Manages the position for each object in a set of managed SmartPositions in an attempt to minimise overlap.
member.remarks: Collision avoidance uses a greedy algorithm running in O(n^2) with O(n) storage. Although there are no known algorithms running in less time than this, simulated annealing may produce slightly better results with comparable execution time.

member.summary:
Place the object with respect to currently placed object. Calling this method causes the object to be immediately updated, but has no effect on previously placed objects.
Placeables which cannot be placed within the placement bounds or without overlapping previously placed objects are hidden
member.param: Object to place.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.RectUtil.GetInflated(Infragistics.Portable.Rect,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Expands or shrinks the current rectangle by using the specified width and height amounts, in all directions. The size and position of the current rectangle are not changed.
member.remarks:
The Width of the resulting rectangle is increased or decreased by twice the specified width offset, because it is applied to both the left and right sides of the rectangle. Likewise, the Height of the resulting rectangle is increased or decreased by twice the specified height.
If the specified width or height shrink the rectangle by more than its current Width or Heightgiving the rectangle a negative areathe rectangle becomes the Empty rectangle.
member.param: The amount by which to expand or shrink the left and right sides of the rectangle.
The amount by which to expand or shrink the top and bottom sides of the rectangle.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1
member.summary: Represents a pool of reusable objects.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1.Pop
member.summary: Gets an object from the pool.
member.remarks: The pool will either Create a new object or Activate one which was previously returned and Disactivated. If DeferDisactivate is set there may be pending active objects available which will be reused directly).

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1.Push(`0)
member.summary: Returns an object to the pool for recycling.
member.remarks:
All references to objects which have been returned to the pool should be destroyed.
When an object is returned to the pool it will be immediately Disactivated (unless DeferDisactivate is set) and may also be Destroyed either immediately or some time later.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1.DeferDisactivate
member.summary: Sets or gets the DeferDisactivate flag.
member.remarks:
When the pool is marked to defer disactivation, objects returned to the pool are not immediately disactivated, instead remaining in a limbo state where they are available for reuse without Activation. Resetting DeferDisactivate causes all of these limbo objects to be disactivated and potentially destroyed.
Deferred disactivation is useful where the activation/disactivation cycle is costle (such as add/remove a VisualElement from a ParentItem Panel).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1.ActiveCount
member.summary: Gets the number of active items in the current StackPool object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1.InactiveCount
member.summary: Gets the number of inactive (not including limbo) items in the current StackPool object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the function used to create new items.

member.summary: Gets if the current data source is a virtual data source.

member.summary: Gets or sets the execution context that the data source should synchronize asynchronous actions with, or use to defer delayed actions.

member.summary: Gets if sorting is supported on the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.IsFilteringSupported
member.summary: Gets if filtering is supported on the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.SortDescriptions
member.summary: Gets a collection to add sort descriptions to. Changing the sort descriptions in this collection will adjust the sort applied to the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.FilterExpressions
member.summary: Gets a collection to add filter expressions to. Changing the filter expressions in this collection will adjust the filter applied to the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.DeferAutoRefresh
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the auto refresh mechanism of the data source is currently defered. The data source will not react to most setting changes while this is set to true an will instead defer processing. Setting this value to false will queue a new refresh.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.PrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of property references that indicate the user provided primary key of the items in the data source. Consumers of the data source will often need to uniquely identify items in the data source. For this purpose a primary key should be specified.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.ActualPrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets the current actual primary key of the data source. This may have been auto detected, if possible, or provided or overriden by the user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.PropertiesRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of property references for the properties desired by the consumer of the data source. If known, the data source may take steps to request only those properties, or to ensure that those properties are included, rather than the default behavior for this type of data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.NotifyUsingSourceIndexes
member.summary: Gets whether, when manually notifying the data source of changes, one should use indexes relative to the actual source data, or relative to the view the data source is maintaining into the data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.IsItemIndexLookupSupported
member.summary: Gets whether lookup of an index for a provided item is supported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.IsKeyIndexLookupSupported
member.summary: Gets whether lookup of an index for a provided primary key value is supported.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.NotifySetItem(System.Int32,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been changed in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the changed item.
The old item at the desginated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.
The new item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.NotifyClearItems
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that the data it has bound to has been cleared and needs to be re-examined. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.NotifyInsertItem(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been inserted in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the inserted item.
The new item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.NotifyRemoveItem(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been removed in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the removed item.
The old item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.QueueAutoRefresh
member.summary: Called to manually queue a refresh of the data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.FlushAutoRefresh
member.summary: Called to make sure a queued refresh of the data source has been applied before continuing. Should only be needed if you are trying to synchronously examine the results of changing settings on the data source. Note, for a virtual data source, the data source itself may be waiting for other synchronous requests to actualize data. This call will not wait for those, but will only make sure the appropriate requests are in flight from the settings changes

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.Refresh
member.summary: Called to synchronously refresh the data source.

member.param: The item for which to find the index.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.Implementation.BaseDataSource.IndexOfKey(System.Object[])
member.summary: Called to return the index for an primary key value contained in the data source, or -1, if the key can't be found, or this action isn't currently supported.
